DOC.brief_title: Response Intermittent Pneumatic Compression Therapy Head Neck Cancer-related Lymphedema
DOC.detailed_description: A non-randomized , non-blinded , single site pilot study design ass whether near-infrared fluorescence image report efficacy pneumatic compression device move lymph head neck cancer survivor result head neck lymphedema .
DOC.criteria: Participants must 18 year age old Participants must diagnose Lymphedema Head and/or Neck Participants must diagnose squamous cell carcinoma oral cavity , oropharynx larynx underwent surgery radiation part standardofcare treatment plan . Participants must ≥ 4 week postradiation therapy Female participant childbearing potential must negative urine pregnancy test ≤ 36 hour prior study drug administration Female participant childbearing potential must agree use medically accept method contraception period one month image session Participants must willing use Flexitouch® System home daily two ( 2 ) week Women pregnant breastfeeding Persons allergic iodine A female childbearing potential , agree use approve contraceptive one month study participation Persons meet inclusion criterion Persons pulmonary edema , thrombophlebitis , congestive heart failure , deep vein thrombosis , episodes pulmonary embolism , infection inflammation , acute cancer Persons uncontrolled hyperthyroidism parathyroidism ( endocrinologist recommend neck compression ) Carotid sinus hypersensitivity syndrome Symptomatic carotid artery disease , manifest recent transient ischemic attack ( within 30 day ) , ischemic stroke , amaurosis fugax ( monocular visual ischemic symptom blindness ) Symptomatic bradycardia absence pacemaker Internal jugular venous thrombosis within 3 month Increased intracranial pressure contraindication internal external jugular venous compression Acute radiation dermatitis , unhealed surgical scar , unhealed open wound ( ) , surgical flap le 68 week postoperative Facial head neck dermal metastasis Acute facial infection ( e.g. , facial parotid gland abscess ) Any condition increase venous lymphatic return undesirable
